availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Editor of the Louisville Journal. Preston, Connecticut native. Married to Harriet Benham Prentice. Father of William Courtland Prentice and Clarence Joseph Prentice. Attended Brown University at Providence, Rhode Island, from 1820 to 1823, where he was tutored by Horace Mann. Studied law in Canterbury, Connecticut. Editor of the Connecticut Mirror in 1827. Editor of the Hartford New England Review in Hartford, Connecticut, in 1828. Moved to Louisville to write a biography of Henry Clay in 1830. Editor of the Louisville Journal from 1830 until 1868.

bibl.p: Thomas D. Clark, "George Dennison Prentice," in John E. Kleber, ed., The Encyclopedia of Louisville (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 722-23.
